markings:
Labels on verso: center stretcher bar [SS/no. 7/E. Vuillard \"Interior\" 1908]; [MIA no. 61-36-19 lent to Wildenstein and Company 9/22/64]; [Bequest of P.D. McMillan]

Marks on verso: pencil script [Vuillard 77]

Labels on backing board: [Haus der Kunst Munchen/Vuillard/E. Vuillard/ The Sunny Room/ Minneapolis Institute of Arts/no. 109]; [Sam Salz, Inc./E. Vuillard/Interior/1908]
text: Edouard Vuillard was a prominent member of the 1890s avant-garde group The Nabis (a Hebrew word meaning "prophet"), who acquired notoriety for their highly decorative, semi-abstract compositions. Vuillard favored representations of bourgeois interiors, often of his family home, as seen in The Sunny Room.
title: The Sunny Room
